abstract: Disgruntled minority shareholders of Shell Canada threatened Wednesday to fight on in court if Royal Dutch Shell succeeds in buying out its Canadian subsidiary at $45 a share. Royal Dutch controls 78 percent of Shell Canada and wants the rest because of its position in the booming Alberta oil sands. Shell Canada outlined Wednesday even more ambitious plans for its exploitation of the resource.
lead_paragraph: Disgruntled minority shareholders of Shell Canada threatened Wednesday to fight on in court if Royal Dutch Shell succeeds in buying out its Canadian subsidiary at $45 a share. Royal Dutch controls 78 percent of Shell Canada and wants the rest because of its position in the booming Alberta oil sands. Shell Canada outlined Wednesday even more ambitious plans for its exploitation of the resource.

headline.main: Shell Canada Investors Vow to Fight Royal Dutch
